remarks.para: It should be noted that when implementing this interface, the editor should retain a reference to the grid passed during InitializeContext so it can set the EditorDirty property to true when the value changes. Failure to do this will result in SandGrid not applying any value in the editor.

member.name: M:Divelements.SandGrid.SandGridBase.PerformElementLayout
member.summary: Causes the grid to layout all its elements synchronously.

remarks.para: By default SandGrid queues layout operations until they are needed, so it can do them all in one batch. This is a substantial performance gain. However in situations where you need to force this to happen at once, e.g. you have added a batch of rows and want one to become visible by calling ScrollElementIntoView, this method forces all pending layout operations to complete.

member.name: M:Divelements.SandGrid.SandGridBase.PointToGrid(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Translates a position from client coordinates to grid coordinates.
member.param: A client position.
member.returns: A grid position.

remarks.para: Because of scrolling, elements in a grid are laid out in grid coordinate space which is different from control client coordinate space. Use this method to translate a position in client coordinates into a position in grid coordinates, suitable for passing to the GetElementAt method.

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionGroupNoRow

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionInsertOnSort
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Insert method cannot be called on a collection of rows that is currently being sorted. To add rows to the collection, use the Add method, and they will be inserted at the appropriate point..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionMeasureCoreNegative
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The size returned by the MeasureCore function cannot be negative in either dimension..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionNegative
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified value cannot be a negative number..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionNoEditorActive
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The attempted operation is not valid when no editor is active..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionNoGrid
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The attempted operation is not valid outside a grid. You need to ensure the element on which you are performing the operation has been added to a grid. If you are using nested grids, ensure that the grid is actually hosted inside a SandGrid control..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionNoNullsInArray
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified array cannot contain null entries..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionNotDataBound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An invalid attempt was made to access a databound feature on an object that is not databound..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionNotPositive
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified value must be a positive integer..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionObjectNdotInGrid
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified object cannot be used because it does not belong to the grid..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionReentrancy
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Reentrancy is not supported within the current method. Check that your code does not call methods such as DoEvents that can result in user interaction with the grid while an existing grid event is still being processed..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionRowsNotSortedProperlyForGrouping
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The rows in the grid have not been sorted appropriately for grouping. This might be because the data source to which the grid is bound does not support sorting correctly..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionSingleCell
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Cells collection of the SingleCellRow has been modified. To use a SingleCellRow there must always be at least one cell present..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionSwitchingVirtualMode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Virtual mode cannot be enabled while the grid is in its current state. The grid must be free of rows and unsorted..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionTypeNotGridRow
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified type does not inherit from GridRow..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionVirtualMode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The requested operation is not valid in a grid operating in virtual mode..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.ExceptionVirtualRowCap
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of rows allowed in virtual mode is currently capped at 1000000..

member.name: P:Divelements.SandGrid.Resources.Messages.MessageUnhandledDataException
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to This message is being displayed because an exception occurred while the grid was trying to process data and the host application has not hooked the DataError event. The most common cause for a data exception is a failure in converting one datatype to another. A common way of handling the event is to display a message box to the user indicating they have entered invalid data (in such a case).
Details of the exception appear below..

member.summary: Creates a highlighted version of a source image.
member.param: The image to highlight.
A value between 0 and 1 specifying the strength of the highlight.
member.returns: A new image with the highlight applied.

The second source colour.
A value that lies between 0 and 1, 0 being the first colour and 1 being the second.
member.returns: The new colour produced after mixing.

member.name: M:Divelements.SandGrid.Rendering.DrawingMethods.DrawDropShadow(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Draws a faded shadow around a rectangle.
member.param: The Graphics object to draw with.
The bounds that represents the rectangle that will get a shadow.
The size, in pixels, of the shadow.
The color of the shadow.

remarks.para: This method is optimized for small shadows. It is not suitable for drawing larger shadows as the corners will stop looking rounded.

member.name: M:Divelements.Util.Registration.DivelementsLicenseProvider.GetSavedLicenseKey(System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext,System.Type)
member.summary: This method is necessary because the default implementation of GetSavedLicenseKey only checks the entry assembly, as long as there is an entry assembly which there nearly always is. So, in the case of failure, this method manally enumerates all loaded managed assemblies (something the default method really should fall back to) and tries to get a key from them. This will result in the key always being found, as long as it's there somewhere.

member.name: T:Divelements.SandGrid.Rendering.IndependentText
member.summary: Provides technology independent text rendering and measuring methods.

remarks.para: It is necessary for text in SandGrid to be renderer with GDI+ when printing and in .NET 1.0/1.1, and optionally with GDI in .NET 2.0. When printing text is always rendered in GDI+. This class there provides independent methods for drawing and measuring text, optimized for SandGrid.
